svg.text: Tree Data Structures - Binary Trees & Operations
Hierarchical Data Organization with Traversal Algorithms

g.text: Node with no children (H, I, F, G)
Node with at least one child (A, B, C, D, E)
Node with children (A is parent of B, C)
• Each node has at most 2 children (left and right)
• Left subtree values < parent < right subtree values (for BST)
• Maximum nodes in tree of height h = 2^(h+1) - 1
Full Binary Tree (every node has 0 or 2 children):
Complete Binary Tree (all levels filled except last, filled left to right):
Perfect Binary Tree (all internal nodes have 2 children, all leaves at same level):
Visit root last, useful for deletion
• Left subtree values < root value < right subtree values
• This property applies recursively to all subtrees
BST Example with Search, Insert, Delete Operations:
Compare with root, go left if smaller, right if larger
Time: O(log n) average, O(n) worst case
Find correct position using search, add as leaf
3 cases: leaf, one child, two children
if not root or root.data == key:
